1.title: The Evolution of Motherhood- Part 1

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

1.plot: Author Suzi Lula in conversation with her 14 year old son William on the new paradigm of parenting from a place of self-love and self-care.

2.title: The Motherhood Evolution Part 2

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

2.plot: Eleven year old Brooklyn interviews author Suzi Lula on her book "The Motherhood Evolution" and what it is like to be a mother in today's age.

3.title: Building Bridges of Peace and Understanding

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

3.plot: Lucie Hake shares her journey of creating her foundation "International Littles Artists- The Voice of Unheard Children" and how she is using art to create bridges of peace and understanding.

4.title: The Voice of the Children

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

4.plot: Lucie Hake, founder of ILA, talks about how art connects children of all abilities. She also talks about the healing power of art when it comes to children with abuse or other traumas.

5.title: The Joy of Intuition and the Gift of Healing

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

5.plot: Being raised in the Philippines, Caren and Bambie were aware of their psychic abilities at an early age. They speak about how they both shut down their gifts during their teenage years and what helped to reawaken them.

6.title: Empowered Dance Communities

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

6.plot: Leslie Scott shares about her work in the professional dance world, and how a trip to an orphanage in Mexico changed her life and started her organization Y.P.A.D.

7.title: Find Your Swag!

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

7.plot: Leslie talks about her organization Y.P.A.D.'s mission to educate dance instructors and parents, so that we can create a safe dance environment, a healthy body image, increase self-worth and raise children who feel good about who they are. We can all learn how to teach children to find their swag and keep it, no matter of the circumstances.

8.title: Holistic Parenting

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

8.plot: Sunny talks about what it was like for her to raise her sons and what she did to raise them in a holistic way.

1.title: Indigo Communication

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

1.plot: Susan Buonocore talks about the new generation of Indigo and Rainbow children, the obstacles these wonderful children are facing (especially when it comes to education as well as interaction with others) and how to overcome them. She gives practical advice to parents, educators and therapists about what we can do to support these children in order to become string individuals.

2.title: Raising Children from the Heartspace

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

2.plot: Szilvia Nagy talks about her journey with her son who was labeled with selective mustism at an early age. This diagnosis put her on her own healing path while looking for alternatives to help her son.

3.title: Nutrition Conscious Parenting

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

3.plot: After her son got diagnosed with ADD (Attention Defizit Disorder), Claire Candy Hough started taking the reigns into her own hands while waiting for her son's appointment with a specialist. Find out how she was able to help her son just by changing his nutrition program.

4.title: Nurturing the Indigo Soul

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

4.plot: Claire Candy Hough talks about how working and communicating with the angles helps children gain confidence, self-respect and trust. Indigo and Rainbow children are extremely sensitive and can feel the beautiful energy of the angels. They can achieve great comfort in stressful situations when being taught how to connect to the angels.

5.title: Children: Our Future

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

5.plot: Cecily Miller, PhD, talks about why it is so important to lay a strong foundation for children. Children are our future, and through conscious parenting and creating compassionate conditions for our children we can help them thrive. If we really want to create a peaceful future, it starts with the first beginnings, pregnancy and early childhood.

6.title: Family Connections

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

6.plot: Laying a healthy foundation for children starts during pregnancy. What can expecting parents do to support that foundation from the start?

7.title: Thriving

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

7.plot: Dr Colbey Forman, Chief Psychoneurologist of the ABP (American Board of Psychoneurology) and Dean of Beurin University talks about the new model of thriving.

8.title: The Gifts of the Children

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

8.plot: Every child has a special gift. Listen to Dr Colbey Forman as he talks about how we can nurture our children in order to help them bring their gifts and talents to the world.

9.title: The Heart of the Indigo

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

9.plot: Fiona Thomas, mother, healer and spiritual teacher, shares her experiences about raising her own Indigo sons and the work she is now doing with Indigo children.

10.title: Teaching Love

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

10.plot: Using the examples of masters and prominent public figures, Dr Colbey Forman explains how we can teach and grow through love.

1.title: A New Humanity

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

1.plot: Substantial shifts can be made in our society and in this world if we can give children support, nurturing and love from the start. Listen to Cecily Miller, PhD as she talks about creating a new humanity by the way we raise our children. From pregnancy to early childhood, children need to have a feeling of safety in order to create a strong sense of self.

2.title: Yoga Nidra for Children

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

2.plot: Yoga Nidra can help children to overcome stressful situations while teaching them to stay balanced when facing challenges.

3.title: Raising the Indigo Child

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

3.plot: Mother and daughter share their experience on being an Indigo Child.

4.title: Supporting the Indigo Child

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

4.plot: Continue listening to Frankie and Teresa as they share their wisdom on how to support the Indigo Child.

5.title: Finding Your Place in the World

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

5.plot: Nathanael Alba talks about how supporting children will help them find their place in the world.

6.title: Healing the World

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

6.plot: Helping children to step into their passions, following what is in our heart and what makes us happy will help heal this world. Listen to the second part of Nathanael Alba's interview about the new generation of children.

7.title: The Life of a Young Indigo

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

7.plot: What is it like growing up knowing that you are an Indigo child.

8.title: The Highly Sensitive Child

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

8.plot: Award-winning author and mentor Maureen Healy talks about how to support highly sensitive children.

9.title: Mentoring the Highly Sensitive Child

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

9.plot: Award-winning author Maureen Healy shares information on how to mentor the highly sensitive child.

10.title: An Indigo Healer

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

10.plot: Iris Tanz talks about the challenges of growing up as an Indigo child and her journey of finding her gifts as a healer.

11.title: An Indigo Mother

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

11.plot: An interview with Iris Tanz about being an Indigo adult and the mother of indigo twins.

12.title: An Indigo Life

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

12.plot: Dana and Jay share what it is like to raise an Indigo child. Their son Tanner talks about being an Indigo.

1.title: A New Generation of Children

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

1.plot: Interview with bestselling author and international speaker Diana Cooper about the new generation of children and the gifts these children are bringing to the planet.

2.title: The Children of the New Golden Age

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

2.plot: Bestselling author and international speaker Diana Cooper speaks about the children who are using in the New Golden Age.

3.title: Supporting the Children of the New Golden Age

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

3.plot: International bestselling author and speaker Diana Cooper talks about how to support children so they can thrive.

4.title: Healing & Chromesthesia- Communicating Through Sights and Sounds

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

4.plot: Interview with Wes Pagano about his journey through a near death experience, anxiety, being prescribed psycho-active medication and his healing through music.

5.title: Teaching Children Through Communication and Creativity

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

5.plot: Educator Victoria Seeborn talks about her work as a Waldorf School teacher and how to teach children through creativity.

6.title: Finding Your Truth

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

6.plot: Allow author, speaker and soul coach Sara Loos to inspire to find your truth and live on purpose.

7.title: Coaching the Leaders of Tomorrow

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

7.plot: In this interview with author and coach Sara Loos we look at alternatives to the current education system and ways to empower children to become the leaders of tomorrow.

8.title: Inspiring Education Across the Globe

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

8.plot: CosmiKids and Inspired Parenting founder Judy Julin talks about creative education models.

9.title: New Paradigms of Education

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

9.plot: Judy Julin, founder of CosmiKids and Inspired Parenting shares inspiration on new education models.

10.title: Indigo- Journey to the Self

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

10.plot: A journey from addiction to healing.

11.title: Raising a Rainbow Child

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

11.plot: Listen to Karina Olszewski as she shares her wisdom on how to support a highly sensitive child.

12.title: Healing Through Ancient Rhythmic Arts

episode of.title: The Children of the Rainbow (TV Series 2013– )

12.plot: An informative talk with Joey Downs, founder of "The Children's Beading Circle" on how to integrate ancient rhythmic arts to help highly sensitive children thrive.

imdb.plot outline: A documentary series about the new generation of Indigo, Crystal and Rainbow Children. Have you ever heard of the term Indigo, Crystal or Rainbow Children? Are you perhaps an Indigo child yourself? Who exactly are these special children and how do you know if your child might be one as well? Rainbow children are the new generation of children that have incarnated on this planet during this particular time in order to help us raise the frequency of the earth and bring a new era of peace and light to this planet. Most Rainbow children have never been on this planet before and have no previous karma. They are very old souls and carry wisdom and knowledge from ancient times and other dimensions. These children live their life from a place of unconditional love and have the ability to change the world around them through their kindness and love. They are very sensitive, have highly empathic skills, a strong intuition and an innate knowing of right and wrong. They are extremely intelligent and often have a special gift in sciences, the arts or healing. Often misdiagnosed with ADD/ ADHD and Autism, these children are being labeled and put in a box that "marks" them as "not fully functioning." The truth is that because of their kind and sensitive nature these children need to be nurtured and given the support and the environment needed to develop their skills and talents so that they can bring their gifts forward into the world. Many parents and even educators have little or no knowledge about the nature of these special children; parents are confronted to deal with the labeling of their children. Many children nowadays are being put on psycho-active medications and are deprived of an environment that would provide the right support and nurturing for them. As parents, grandparents, teachers, and healthcare practitioners it is our utmost responsibility to educate ourselves about these special children and create a loving environment in which they can thrive and bring their magnificence into the world.
imdb.title: The Children of the Rainbow
akas: The Children of the Rainbow (United States)
